Text.Value: You'll regret this.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resentful; she WILL make you regret it

Text.Value: A pacifist. In Baldur's Gate? Ha. Nobody's leaving this place alive, cuck.
Minsc is Minsc. Minsc was once this Lord of Stone - but he got better.
Slice them! Slice them now!

EditorData.NodeContext: Almost frenzied; she's keen to slice

Text.Value: Are you serious?
Nobody messes with the Stone Lord, ratling.
This Stone Lord sounds like a better bet.
I think I'll just kill both of you and take everything, thanks.
Come now, can we not resolve this with words? A round of flyting, perhaps?
Can't we just all get along? Must we really fight?
Well, my spellbook ink is not cheap at all - let's do this.
Who am I to turn down a paying customer? Let's do this.
I could go for some spoils - I'm in.
The Stone Lord doesn't need your help, cuck. Nobody but us leaves this place alive.

EditorData.NodeContext: Amused; just about stops himself from laughing out loud

Text.Value: You picked the wrong side, cuck.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unphased; confident he'll kill the player

Text.Value: Minsc, they keep mentioning the Stone Lord. Time to introduce yourself?
Oh shit, that's the Stone Lord?
Too late, cuck. Nobody but us leaves this place alive.
Well. That is not entirely true.

EditorData.NodeContext: SHEEPISH INTERJECTION BETWEEN TWO CROOKS SAYING THE STONE LORD IS UNBEATABLE.

Text.Value: You - help me kill these arses! The Guild will sprinkle you with gold.

EditorData.NodeContext: Keen to enlist the player (and confident in her offer)

Text.Value: Nine-Fingers sends her love, arsehole. Your Stone Lord's a dead man walking.
Nah, they're lying - that big lump's nowhere near old enough.
Stone Lord liars... Stone Lord toelickers - you all get sliced just the same.
I'd rather not get involved in whatever this is.

Synopsis:
Battle is about to begin between the Attackers (Farlin's The Guild's force) and the Smugglers (Cairos's Stone Man's forces) who are obviously overwhelmingly stronger. The Guild under-estimated the power of the Stone Man.

The Attackers have already suffered significant loses against traps and an ealier ambush.  

The Attacker's leader, Farlin sees the player's party and decides to enlist their help - despite not knowing who they are, desperate as she is.

If the player agrees, the Attackers will turn allies for the duration of the encounter (unless players directly attacks them).

Smugglers are hostile to both Attackers and players - despite their choices. You after all did just want into their smuggling operations uninvited.

The players may choose to not get involved, in which case the attackers will lose without the players help.
